gol.Model.Board

Class DynamicBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • gol.Model.Board.DynamicBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InterfaceBoard

    public class DynamicBoard
extends java.lang.Object
implements InterfaceBoard
    Created by Momcilo Delic on 4/8/2017. The class implements an Interface This will make it easier for me to switch between the classes and methods in my controller.

      void patternDown()
      Making an empty ArrayList, Checking where getLive is == 1 gets x and adds with movedistance (movedistance = 1) and sets the bytes to 1 Since it adds x, the pattern will move down
      void patternLeft()
      Doing the exact same like in the other pattern methods only here i substract y with movedistance
      void patternRight()
      Doing the exact same like in the other pattern methods only here i add y with movedistance
      void patternUp()
      Making an empty ArrayList, Checking where getLive is == 1 gets x and subtracts with movedistance (movedistance = 1) and sets the bytes to 1 Since it subtract x, the pattern will move up

      Random generator, randomness set to 2

      • setLive

        public void setLive(int x,
                    int y,
                    byte state)
        This is a setLive method for my DynamicBoard I'm using an exact method in my StaticBoard class This makes it easier for me when implementing methods through my Interface. For instance in my draw method in the Controller when i call setLive it can go both ways.
        Specified by:
        setLive in interface InterfaceBoard
        Parameters:
        x - gets the x
        y - gets the y
        state - sets the state of the cell in byte

      • patternUp

        public void patternUp()
        Making an empty ArrayList, Checking where getLive is == 1 gets x and subtracts with movedistance (movedistance = 1) and sets the bytes to 1 Since it subtract x, the pattern will move up
        Specified by:
        patternUp in interface InterfaceBoard

      • nextGeneration

        public void nextGeneration(int start,
                           int stop)
        Next generation, counts neighbours and sets next generation. If there is less than two neighbours the cell dies. Cells with two or three neighbours continues to live. Cells with more than three neighbours die. If a dead cell is surrounded with 3 alive cells, it becomes alive. In addition this board will expand if the cells hit near the corners by adding left/right/top/down
        Specified by:
        nextGeneration in interface InterfaceBoard
        Parameters:
        start -
        stop -

      • fastPopulateRule

        public void fastPopulateRule()
        Mix it up and spice it up a little bit >:) This is where Game of Life gets dangerous and exciting! (not really) For every cell that has 3 alive neighbours, it will be set alive on next gen
        Specified by:
        fastPopulateRule in interface InterfaceBoard

      • ImprovizedRule

        public void ImprovizedRule()
        This is an improvized rule i made, it can make some cool pattern especially if you load and play a file I like to call this the ImprovizedRule a.k.a Epilepsy Attack. If it counts 1 neighbour 1, it will be set 0 If it counts 2 neighbours, it will be set to 1 If it counts 3 neighbours, it will also be set alive
        Specified by:
        ImprovizedRule in interface InterfaceBoard
